result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 07/29/15 Probation extended for 1 additional year until 09/17/2016 due to unpaid obligations.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Domino's to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. No use or possession of illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 09/26/14 by 5pm. LAST 20 days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric J Watson in court with Attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is striken.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $50.00 to Dominos (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS - Last 20 DAYS STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion)- Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 9/26/14 by 5:00 p.m.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric J Watson in court with Attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Penegor requests a plea and sentence date. Court grants request.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Eric J Watson in court with attorney Joan B Broughton by Atty. Joseph Smith.

Atty. Smith states that Defendant requests that Atty. Broughton be allowed to withdraw and a different attorney be appointed.
Court Grants - Atty. Broughton will be allowed to withdraw.
Public defenders office to appoint a new attorney.


  Hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
